alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Fulton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hamilton, northwestern Fulton and east central Herkimer Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Middleville, or 10 miles north of Little Falls, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stratford, Norway, Oregon, Black Creek Reservoir, Curtis, Averys Place, Wood Corners, Bliss Corner, Emmonsburg, Stewart Landing, Bull Hill, Knappville, Paper Mill Corners, Middle Sprite, Salisbury Center, Fairview Corners, Ives Hollow and Newkirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern New York.
